page.title: 02LANDSCAPE TO THE EAST
page.content: {Landscape}divides into 2 distinct types:the area to the east,which is the foothills of the Ochils and the area to the west,a more populated open family area. {Foothills of Ochils.}This appears to be a windswept area of gently rolling hills covered with heather;ideal for grouse & pheasant shooting which starts in August.There are many minor roads,with passing places,joining and leading to small farms which estate workers & shepherds tenant.Sheep in this area are the small hardy Scottish blackface.There are small patches of estate plantation, otherwise the area has a few groups of trees planted as a windbreak. Drystane dykes can be seen where farm boundaries once were,now they are gradually being replaced by fences.Skeletons of forgotten crofts can be seen on the hillside in the sun
